    • Method Detail

      • checkForIncompleteTransaction

        void checkForIncompleteTransaction(android.app.Activity context,
                                 int reqCode,
                                 java.lang.String username)
        To check if a previous card transaction is pending. A card transaction could be pending if no response was received after the transaction was initiated or if there was an app crash after the transaction was initiated. The Ezetap SDK checks for pending transactions at the very next Ezetap API call, it is recommeded that calling applications call this API at the appropriate time for eg. - upon login or upon calling pay cash where the handling is not done by the Ezetap system.
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity's context
        reqCode - - Request code for handling the response
        username - - Ezetap username

      • checkForUpdate

        void checkForUpdate(android.app.Activity context,
                  int reqCode,
                  java.lang.String username)
        To check if there is an Ezetap Service app update available call this method. Upon receiving a response, use EzetapAppUpdateResponse to check if there are updates, if so what the severity is and the download URL. EzetapAppUpdateResponse contains the following info :

        updateAvailable - true indicates there is an update available
        filesize - size of the update in bytes
        ezetapAppId - ezetap_android_service, the app id of the Ezetap Service app
        downloadUrl - the update download URL. You may use EzetapDownloadUtils to download and install the update.
        downloadSeverity - an integer describing the severity of the available update
        EzetapAppUpdateResponse.MANDATORY_UPDATE = 0
        EzetapAppUpdateResponse.OPTIONAL_UPDATE = 1
        versionName - the version name of the update (eg. 2.2.23 etc)
        updateNotes - a cumulative list of all available updates between the current version and the available version

        All updates are cumulative in nature - for eg. if you are on version 2.2.23 and the available is version 2.2.26, it will contain all updates in 2.2.24, 2,2,25 and 2.2.26
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity's context
        reqCode - - Request code for handling the response
        username - - Ezetap username

      • startCardPayment

        void startCardPayment(android.app.Activity context,
                    int reqCode,
                    java.lang.String username,
                    double amount,
                    java.lang.String orderNumber,
                    double tip,
                    java.lang.String mobile,
                    java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> appData)
        To initiate a card payment transaction, application should call this method with following parameters:
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity's context
        reqCode - - Request code for handling response
        username - - Ezetap username
        amount - - Transaction amount
        orderNumber - - External Reference associated with the transaction
        tip - - Tip for this transaction (can be zero)
        mobile - - Mobile number of customer (optional)
        appData - - Opaque App specific data (optional)

        orderNumber - - External Reference associated with the transaction

      • attachSignature

        void attachSignature(android.app.Activity context,
                   int reqCode,
                   java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String txnId)
        Attach signature to existing transaction, application should call this method with following parameters:
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity's context
        reqCode - - Request code for handling response
        username - - Ezetap username
        txnID - - Transaction ID to attach signature

      • attachSignature

        void attachSignature(android.app.Activity context,
                   int reqCode,
                   java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String txnId,
                   android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                   android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat format)
        Attach signature to an existing transaction. This method is to be called when signature is captured by the calling application, with the following parameters :
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity
        reqCode - - Request code for handling response
        username - - Ezetap username
        txnId - - Transaction ID to attach signature
        bitmap - - Bitmap containing the signature
        format - - Compression format (supported format - CompressFormat.PNG)

      • attachSignature

        void attachSignature(android.app.Activity context,
                   int reqCode,
                   java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String txnId,
                   java.lang.String emiId,
                   android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                   android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat format)
        Attach signature to an existing transaction. This method is to be called to convert a transaction to EMI when signature is captured by the calling application, with the following parameters :
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity
        reqCode - - Request code for handling response
        username - - Ezetap username
        txnId - - Transaction ID to attach signature
        emiId - - EMI ID to convert this txn to EMI. Pass null if you don't want to convert this transaction to EMI. - EMI ID can be retrieved from the Transaction Details of startCardPayment request.
        bitmap - - Bitmap containing the signature. Mandatory for EMI Transactions
        format - - Compression format (supported format - CompressFormat.PNG)

      • startLoginRequest

        void startLoginRequest(android.app.Activity context,
                     int reqCode,
                     java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
        Initiate login request, application should call this mode if login auth mode is set to custom with following parameters:
        Parameters:
        context - - Calling activity
        reqCode - - Request code for handling response
        username - - Ezetap username
        password - - Ezetap password
